oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Longitudinal study on the influence of vaccination, marketing and BRD outcomes on gene expression in beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ramirez, Bradly
McAllister, Hudson
Capik, Sarah
Valeris-Chacin, Robert
Harvey, Kelsey
Woolums, Amelia
Karisch, Brandi
Scott, Matthew
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine respiratory disease (BRD) is a multifactorial disease complex resulting from the interaction of various pathologic, immune-mediated and management-driven factors. Specifi足cally, management decisions around vaccination against viral components of BRD, marketing through commercial sale sys足tems, and long-haul shipping of cattle modulate the bovine im足mune system and susceptibility to disease. Therefore, we inves足tigated these factors and their influence on immunomodulation via RNA sequencing methodology.
